mods.abstract: TWENTY DOLLARS REWARD.--Ran away on the 25th January, my negro woman ELOUISE and her yellow childe LEESER. The woman is about 23 years of age, of griffe color, has a mould on her upper lip, between the mouth and the nose, has a front tooth out, and has large holes in her ears, a small scratch on her throat, speaks broken English, and is about 5 feet 4 or 5 inches high. Her child is a light mulatto 22 months old, has three or four teeth. She is likely and lively. They formerly belonged to Dr. Beauregard, and has been living with a man calling himself Callics, stone cutter, corner of St. Louis and Villere streets. A further reward of $20 will be paid on conviction, if harbored by a white person or free person of color. J.C. LABATT, 203 Julia street. fe9 3t

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
